definition:
The [*United States of America Mathematical Olympiad*]{} (USAMO) is an
invitation-only mathematical competition sponsored by the Mathematical
Association of America and hosted by the University of Nebraska-Lincoln.
It is a 2-day event in which the contestants try to give proofs to six
mathematical problems. The judges award 0 to 7 points to each solution,
thus a perfect score is points. The winners go on to represent the
United States in the International Mathematical Olympiad. Currently, the
Internet is used to present the problems the first day of the
competition; on the second day the contestants fax back their answers.
The official website of the competition is .
phrase: United States Of America Mathematical Olympiad
